website_summaries.verdict: Solid power and performance for a reasonable price.
pros: Above-average suction on hard flooring and works surprisingly well on carpets, too
Cordless convenience powered by a reliable battery
Battery fuel gauge makes it easy to see when it's running low
cons: Doesn't convert to a handheld vacuum
Extra batteries must be purchased separately

website_summaries.verdict: Convenient and cordless with intuitive features.
pros: Cordless convenience to clean anywhere without being tethered to an outlet
"Fade-free" lithium-ion battery system means strong cleaning even at the end of a battery charge
The wide cleaning path and edge cleaning bristles shorten cleaning time
Users love the power controls placed on the handle
cons: A newer version of this vacuum exists, so many users might want the upgrade

website_summaries.verdict: Sleek, thin design makes this perfect to leave out, or fit it in a small closet.
pros: Powered by a battery and charger – no need to plug and unplug vacuum every time you enter a new room
Handle leans way back so you can easily reach under furniture
Will last around 30 minutes before needing recharging
Only takes 3 hours to fully recharge
cons: No attachment tools included or available for purchase
Like all cordless vacs, the debris canister is small

customer_reviews.title: Charger died in 11 months.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this back in January of 2016. From that day forward, it worked great. Battery would run about 15-20 minutes, enough to run through the place quickly. Works on wood floors and carpeting. Then, today (12/10) the charger stopped charging. Not sure if it's the battery or the charger, but I have a feeling it is the charger. Plug it in and I get a quick flash, then nothing. Testing it shows less than 5 volts output. Very discouraging. Thinking I could order another charger, but it costs almost as much as the new price on the vacuum. It's supposed to have a 2 year warranty and I have contacted Hoover. Let's see how well they stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: Murph

customer_reviews.title: I did not pay thinking to use it only for 30 days more like 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Of course, it broke down on us the 30th day of use (yesterday), unbelievable! To the seller, please replace it. I did not pay thinking to use it only for 30 days more like 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: Ira Martin

customer_reviews.title: Some parts made of self destructing rubber?
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum has good suction for its size. Until it gets clogged. It gets clogged often but I'm not sure that's the fault of the vacuum. The Battery life is pretty good and it charges fast. The Bad: The rubber started peeling off after about 1 month of use. A vacuum at this price point should be made of better materials. We ordered 3 of them and they all had this problem. Little chunks of plastic falling off. At least you can vacuum up the plastic with ease. =)
customer_reviews.author: iLoveAmazonSmile

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't truly vacuum - debris gets stuck in intake tube
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these for years and loved it, then it eventually died. I've had this new one a few months now, and it doesn't really work. It seems like it's vacuuming, but then one day it will stop. And I will turn it over and see that all the debris it's been "vacuuming" is just all jammed up in the intake tube. My husband and I will fish it all out and try again, but it just begins getting stuck in the tub all over again. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Skies

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and works great!
customer_reviews.text: This has made my life so much easier! I have pets and need to clean the floors regularly but hated to bother dragging out the vacuum all the time. This is sooo much easier! It cleans my floor well and suction works great. I read some reviews stating that people had problems with suction after a period of time but it clearly comes with instructions to check for things getting stuck and causing an obstruction. I expect that if you keep it clear of debris it will keep working the same as it does now. It is very easy to empty and easy to rinse the filter. Very light weight and cleans several rooms in just minutes!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Works alright, but it needs a LOT of maintenance to keep it functional
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so this is all-in-all a cool hoover. Does the job like it's supposed to, as long as you keep the battery charged at all times. My only complaint is that it's not very easy to clean the air tubes unless I unscrew the entire bottom of the thing. I've got a lot of hair (both human and pet) on the floor and to pull all that debris out of the tube/bottom piece every time just to make the suction work well is kind of exhausting. I try to keep it clean after each use, but I just wish it had an easier way to take all the mess out of it. Otherwise, it's pretty great.
customer_reviews.author: ELLIOTT

customer_reviews.title: Battery is crap
customer_reviews.text: Vacuum itself was great....while it worked. Although we followed directions and charged the battery for the full three hours prior to the first use, it almost immediately registered as 1/3 battery life. Within a few short minutes, power to the vacuum was significantly decreased and then stopped altogether. This all happened less than a week after purchasing. Will be returning and getting a corded vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: SJHorst

customer_reviews.title: Not So User Friendly
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this vac to replace my Electrolux whose battery had died. Not thrilled with this vac. No light for darker spaces, head does not swivel as easily as my old stick vac, if you pull too far up on the handle you need to use your foot again to get the head to lie flat, and you can't simply grab the vac and go without inserting the battery. When you are finished, you need to pull out the battery to put it back on the charger. My old vac was 5 years old and just so much user friendly. I will use this vac until the battery dies, but look forward to replacing it with the Electrolux.
customer_reviews.author: BettyLou

customer_reviews.title: Buy It!
customer_reviews.text: I read a CNET Review that rated the Hoover Linx as a "best buy" with high ratings on hardwood floors. I tried the "Swifter" type products and they were a bust. Took a chance on the Hoover Linx and I am very glad I did. This machine is excellent at picking up all types of dust, hair, crumbs, etc. I did not miss anything. Worked very well on my sectional rugs as well. I bought an extra battery so I didn't have to wait to finish cleaning. So far battery life is excellent. I recommend without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Sarin

customer_reviews.title: Charger stopped working
customer_reviews.text: About 9 months in the charger stopped working. Reading the reviews I see it happened to someone else. The unit itself is good, I do find it a pain to empty the container, you have to unscrew a few parts inside and most of the time pull out the dog hair that wraps around the inside. That ends in a mess. But it did work well until now as I need to purchase a new charger.
customer_reviews.author: K. W.

customer_reviews.title: Great suction, great battery, and relatively quiet
customer_reviews.text: I like this vacuum a lot. We were unable to find a perfect vacuum for our needs prior to buying this vacuum. The battery lasts more than enough time, I usually get to use this twice to do my entire house before needing to charge. The bin to collect the hair and items that get sucked up is relatively small but it is easy to take out and pour the waste into the garbage. It has good suction power as well. Able to do my hardwood floors and carpet. We are very satisfied with our purchase. Finally found the vacuum that works for our needs. Our dog sheds a lot and this easy handles her hair.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Use this everyday!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little vacuum cleaner over 5 years ago and it’s still going strong. I use it every single day and it still even has the same rechargeable battery that came with it. It’s amazing and well worth the money. Keeps my hardwoods clean between steam mops and now that I’ve had it so long I can’t see living without it, ha. It even picks glitter right up off the floor that gets in the grooves of the wood in just one pass. Definitely the best purchase I have made on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: C Douglas

customer_reviews.title: This is the best little vacuum cleaner
customer_reviews.text: This is the best little vacuum cleaner! It works as well as the big heavy hard to maneuver ones. It goes around hard to get corners and under most furniture. Just make sure you clean out the canister often so the dirt, dog hair etc does not clog the machine. The battery last for one good cleaning in a 4,000 square foot home. Hint: Let the battery run down all the way before you put it on the charger. These are lithium batteries. If you don't let them run out and then charge, your battery life will be shortened.Don't leave in charge after the blue light is steady on the battery charger.
customer_reviews.author: Marti Miller

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and effective.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased two of these Linx stock vacuums over the course of 6 years and I highly recommend the product. It’s convenient and cleans carpets and hardwoods equally effectively. I have two chargers so I can charge one while I’m vacuuming. I can’t offer a review on the amount of time the battery charge lasts because I haven’t run out of “juice” in a single use. I just recharge after each use. I do not have a pet that sheds heavily but I do have rugs that shed a lot. I recommend cleaning the spinner brush occasionally to keep the vacuum in good mechanical shape.
customer_reviews.author: Wkmurphy

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for several years and always know when it's plugged up for the dirt I've picked up dumps on the floor when I turn it off. It's because the fuzz plugs up the tube into the dirt bin. Now I know that rather than disassemble the bottom, i can use my little finger to pry out the fuzz that blocks the suction. POOR DESIGN! Give me an easy access to that tube to clean it out. Other than that I love it. (I have no pets....use it mainly in the kitchen and family room.)
customer_reviews.author: MaHubs

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for everyday light usage  Update .. no longer working.:
customer_reviews.text: We needed a cordless, lower priced upright vacuum for occasional use so that we did not have to haul out our heavy corded unit for light cleanups. This fits the bill. Very easy to assemble. Easy to handle. Vacuumed both hardwood and carpet this afternoon. Excellent on stairs. So far, so good. Follow up: After just 2 months, battery and/or charger stopped working. Took to vacuum cleaner repair shop. Cost of replacement battery? Around $90.00! Only two months of use!! Whatever happened to Hoover quality? Vacuum store owner said Hoover has been sold many times and now in the hands of very weak management.
customer_reviews.author: Homer Simpson

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This is an EXCELLENT VACUUM. It has good power on hardwood, tile and rugs; it is lightweight, incredibly easy to clean, lays nearly flat and turns to both sides. Two batteries allows me to vacuum three or four rooms and a hallway a minimum of three times before needing to change the battery, and there is of course NO CORD. I have three vacuums and a rug/floor cleaner. I will now be able to eliminate the vacuums. It's a modern day broom.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry L. Browning

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy USED
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a ‘Used- Like New’ vacuum from amazon. I opened it up knowing it was used but the condition it was in was BEYOND rediculous! I would definitely not say it was ‘Like New’ the cracks on the plastic dirt collector was cracked all around and the handle was all peeled and was completely worn out! So I returned the old one and bought a brand new one and hoping i have a better impression of it!!
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: The battery will die on you and cost a lot to replace
customer_reviews.text: I liked this cordless vacuum at first. HOWEVER, the battery quickly started losing its charge after just a few minutes of use, then the battery itself went entirely kaput. I threw it in the closet for a couple of years and found it again while cleaning. I went online to get a new battery (rather than throw the vacuum away) and found it was $60 (for a vacuum that only cost $120) with LOTS of reviews saying that the battery won't last very long (for that price, it should last a LONG time); never mind, in the trash you go.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend!
customer_reviews.text: It is loud! I purchased in October. Only used about 6 times and tried to use yesterday and nothing worked! Battery was fully charged when I used it last. Tried to charge again. Nothing works. Completely dead! I am +70 so has not been mistreated in any way. Looks brand new. DO NOT RECOMMEND! Bought it because recommended by Everyday Cheapskate.
customer_reviews.author: Stella Carnahan

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT! I NEVER USE MY LARGER VAC SINCE BUYING THIS!
customer_reviews.text: Works well, vacs house easily on a charge. Will go about three full turns, then recharge. It captures long hair...it will amaze you. And, it captures fine dirt that is like powder. I use it on shag carpet and laminate flooring. The ability to turn the roller brush is nice on hardwood floors. This is the second one I have owned. The best one on the market for what it does!
customer_reviews.author: Kenny P.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite of my four cordless vacuums.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one our family has ordered. Love this little guy, giant two section dirt and large particle waste compartments. Absolutely the best of all cordless in terms of vacuuming carpets. No question. I love the thumb control on the handle. I love the removable battery that I can charge anywhere. The most power of any of my cordless vacuums, of which I have three others. The only detriment is every once in a while the U-turn from the floor head to the standing part can get stuck if there are larger items being vacuumed. I wish it had a better swivel on the head, and that it had some headlights.
customer_reviews.author: Henslee W.

customer_reviews.title: Great suction on hard floors!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: GREAT suction on hard floors. Gets right into corners and up against cabinets/walls. Easy to empty dirt cup, Battery charger can be put anywhere - doesn't need to be next to where you keep vac. Picks up even very small particles easily, no spitting out the rear on hard floors. Cons: Battery doesn't last very long, and when goes out, no notice, just goes off. Be sure to get 2 batteries! Not great suction on frieze carpet but ok for throw rugs and low-pile carpet. Battery cost is high, and you need two batteries, one charging while one in use
customer_reviews.author: Wenger6

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: OK, love this product. Read some reviews before buying it and the only explanation for some of the critical ones is that they must be put up to it by some of the (more pricy) competitors. I read things like having hard plastic wheels that scratch the floors....nonsense, because mine are covered with outer rubber covering so it moves smoothly, quietly and effortlessly across the kitchen and hardwood floors. Also love the easily removable battery for charging purposes....no stupid docking station needed taking up space on the floor. Oh yeah....I am a licensed professional engineer and this product suits me just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: Love this vacuum. Great for hard floors, and not too bad on carpets for a quick clean-up. Have used this vacuum since it first came out years ago. Batteries/chargers last! Tank is easy to empty and clean. Longer hair will wrap around the roller, but it's easy to remove. Was concerned this model would eventually be discontinued so I bought two 'just in case'. My original Hoover Linx Vacuums purchased years ago are still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last a year before developing a problem!
customer_reviews.text: When did appliances become so disposable? This vacuum worked fine for 8 months, then it stopped turning on, occasionally. My first thought was I didn't charge the battery completely, then I realized it wasn't the battery, it has some kind of intermittent problem with the switch, and is just getting worse and more frequent. This is the most aggravating purchase I have ever made. I am not handy, so I won't be fixing it, and I will not throw good money after bad and pay for repair to something that did not last even 8 months before having problems. What a piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: Deebee

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely disappointed with this vacuum. This is the third Hoover cordless vacuum that I have had, and it is by far the worst. The battery doesn’t last more than about 30 minutes, it does not have very good suction, and compared to the other ones it doesn’t have near the features or the suction. Definitely would not buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Vicsteronii

customer_reviews.title: Hoover Linx cordless
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Hoover Linx. The first one died in a battle; the vacuum was not to blame. I was happy with the first one; I'm happier with the second one. Suction is great; does the job. Again, as I mentioned somewhere else, the engineering didn't address the overbalancing problem, so the thing falls over a lot unless you're careful where and how it stands when not in use. I've started lying it down on the floor so I don't knock it over. I'm convinced that a lot of them die when they've fallen a few dozen times and knocked the motor and housing out of whack.
customer_reviews.author: ShopThis

customer_reviews.title: Three & a half years and still going!
customer_reviews.text: After going through three of another brand in three years, I chose the Hoover Linx because the battery is easily removable and I could buy a replacement. I was just telling a friend how much I love my cordless stick vac and have had it quite a while, when I saw it's been 3 1/2 years and the original battery is still going strong. I think I can vacuum about 400 sq ft of tile and area rugs before needing to recharge, so get the extra battery if you vacuum a really large area and/or vacuum often, just so you don't have to wait for the single battery to recharge.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshinegirrl

customer_reviews.title: Clogs up
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a design flaw in that the debris captured via power brush head CLOGS up after 2-4 uses. Then you have to remove the the power head and disassemble (10 small screws) then manually scrape and clean tube/vent running from the power head to into the primary debris collection bin. .....a real pain in the ******. Mine had a 4 inch section in the power head full clogged and did not work at all until I disassembled and cleaned the power head.
customer_reviews.author: T. L. Allred

customer_reviews.title: Great cordless vac
customer_reviews.text: After having a Eureka Floor sweeper for 3 years I purchased this and could not be happier. I own a Hoover cyclone vacuum cleaner and this is just like a smaller version of it. The suction is very good and it is easy to get around the house. As with any cordless vac I only use to spot clean as I don't think you can replace a corded vac for true cleaning. The battery runs around 20 minutes on a full charge.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Loving it so far!
customer_reviews.text: Structure wise, this vacuum it not what I expected. It's made of plastic and does not appear very sturdy; however, it delivers! I received it yesterday and have only used it once, but I'm impressed. The battery must be charged for three hours. When it was done charging I gave it a whirl. I had already sweep and used my Sweeper on my hardwood floors, and thought they looked pretty clean. After using this guy, I was shocked by what was left behind! I've recently adopted a cat, so not only was there cat hair, but also dirt and dust (pretty gross). I'm hoping it'll hold up!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy_ann

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum, sustained suction, good battery life.
customer_reviews.text: According to my purchase history, I bought this in 2017. I have a yellow lab and had a German shepherd so it gets used a LOT. Hardwood floors with area rugs and tile in bathrooms. It works on all surfaces and has held up really well. Still has great suction and battery life. I am reordering because the handle has gotten wobbly but considering the amount of use, that’s fine. The fact that I want to reorder the same one should say something.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Good Suction
customer_reviews.text: Has good suction. Battery lasts enough to do 2 quick cleans around the house. Battery recharge a couple hours. Decent stick vacuum for the cost. Only things I don't like about it: a little cumbersome trying to vacuum steps, no lever to release the vac from upright standing you have to just hold cleaner part down with your foot and pull handle back so sometimes it gets back in the upright lock position when not intended, fairly small dirt container so need to empty often.
customer_reviews.author: Queen

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, battery charges quickly. Has a suction only port for large items (not elephants!) and with the whirling brushes cleans rugs and sucks up the pieces at the same time. So, what's to recommend about this machine?? Everything, everything. Everything works well, simple to clean, filter easy to change or clean.There is one recommendation, and an important one. Being battery powered, a wise move would be to right off purchase a spare battery. Another good idea would be to buy some extra filters.. I never liked to vacuum. That is, I didn't until I got this marvelous machine. Excellent buy and pure pleasure to operate!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Myron Bonnell

customer_reviews.title: Best invention ever
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these. One on each end of the house. This is a must if you don't have carpet. So convenient and easy. Battery last 4 or 5 days and easy to recharge. Tip-When the battery light starts flashing, if you turn it off it will not run until recharged. If you continue vacuuming, it will run for 10 or 15 more minutes. I do this a lot and just run over the whole house. I believe the battery lasts longer by cycling it this way occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I would like to say this is my second purchase of this vacuum broom. I have been using the this vacuum for at least 3 years without any problems. I use this on tile, hardwood and carpet. It obviously does better on the tile and wood, but works well enough on carpet. It's lightweight, charge last enough for the entire house without dying, head swivels, low enough to get under cabinet edges, quiet and easy to empty debris from canister. I believe it is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: R. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and effective on all flooring
customer_reviews.text: Love this handy vacuum! I read reviews from a tech group, and they raved about the vacuum. It is especially good on hard floors (rated 10 for 10). There is also a roller brush that works quite well on area rugs. I don't have carpet so I can't give any feedback for carpeting. However for a lower pile carpet I bet it would do very well. I appreciate not having a cord to haul around, plug and unplug, etc. The battery for this vacuum charges in less than 4 hours, and a charge lasts quite a while- 30 - 40+ minutes. It's a great choice, and I am very happy with it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Lithander

customer_reviews.title: Won't turn on after having a five days.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after five days and about an hour total usage. Won't turn on. Had a small piece of plastic caught in roller about size of first join t pinky. Roller then turned easily by hand, so it was clear, Battery fully charged. When it worked was very good, and battery charged in three hours. Had bought because of many stellar reviews. Couldn't return to Amazon because in hospital for three weeks. Waste of money. Will buy another brand of cordless vac.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Scharf

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, Portable and
customer_reviews.text: Excellent vac. Light weight easy to maneuver and amazing suction for a portable battery powered device. Easy to set up; just follow the directions. I have been using it for several days and am still impressed. I bought for a sale price and couldn't be more satisfied. A follow up review. The battery doesn't hold a charge for more than ten minutes and the charger recharges in one minute but doesn't fully charge. Will be returning. Battery staying power is lame.
customer_reviews.author: John H

customer_reviews.title: great for pet hair/hard wood
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this vacuum for a month or so, but it's been fantastic so far. I got it because I have all hardwood floors except for a couple small area rugs and I needed something to pick up pet hair. I love that you can easily switch it from hardwood to carpet without missing a beat, the battery lasts long enough for me to vacuum the whole house, it empties into the trash super easily, and I love that it has an indicator for how much battery is left. I'm hoping that this lasts at least a couple years, if so I would definitely purchase another one down the line when needed.
customer_reviews.author: noky64

customer_reviews.title: Easy quickly Cleaning without dealing with cable.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a baby/ toddler, this is perfect for you.When the food spill, when the crunches, cereals. puffs, pieces all around, when the unexpected guests want to come over, this will help you a lot. It will take 2 minute to clean the mess. you do not have to deal with cable. and also it is not heavy. easy to clean. only thing is it does not stand by itself you should lean it up on the wall or something....
customer_reviews.author: Tanju

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Cordless Vacuum!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my parents to replace a cordless vacuum they absolutely loved. My father absolutely loves it and even recommended I purchase one for myself. They have hardwood floors everywhere but they also use this on low pile area rugs. It keeps the charge, is small and light weight, and does a great job picking up after all the grand kids come over. Definitely worth the buy and the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Vacuum/Bad Battery
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to give this 5 stars for how great the suction is on this vacuum, and how light it is to use. But the big problem is that the battery doesn't last as long as the vacuum. When new, this vacuum will go at least 20 minutes at full speed, but little by little, you get less and less battery time. This happened the last time I bought this vacuum, and since the battery cost almost as much as a new vacuum, I just bought a new one. Sure enough, about 9 months after purchase, I could only get about 3 minutes of battery life. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Constance Wellik

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I love this lightweight vacuum for cleanups between regular cleanings. It's weight is easy on my arthritic hands. The charge does not last long for heavy cleanings, but I have vacuumed my 1900 SF place with hardwood and carpeted floors with one complete charge. What it is really great for is occasional dry spills and cleaning up crumbs around table and in kitchen which is what I was looking for. I like being able to store it in a small spot in my laundry room and it does not have to be stored on a charger. It is very easy and simple to empty and clean.
customer_reviews.author: brezz

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is not good
customer_reviews.text: The battery only lasts for a few minutes. Since the vacuum is still under warranty, Hoover said to return it with the charger or they would give me a discount on a new battery and charger. They informed me that the normal length of time for the battery to run is 10 to 12 minutes. Nobody can vacuum a house in that short amount of time, Will never buy a Hoover product again. Bad customer service. Very uncooperative.
customer_reviews.author: George S. Mead

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly convenient. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Love this vacuum and use it all the time. The convenience of having a cordless vacuum has led to our house being much cleaner. The battery lasts plenty long for my entire first floor which is all hardwood floors. It's not intended for a deap clean of carpet... you'll need a corded vacuum for that. However, if all you are interested in is cleaning up the pet hair and food crumbs off of a hardwood floor, than this is perfect. I've had 2 family members buy a cordless vacuum after they saw ours.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have had several of these over the 5+ years using them both for my condo and for the cleaning people of our building. They work great (strong suction, long battery life, easy to clean) for a lower price then the competition. If you are going to use them commercially, a second battery helps a lot. Some reviews have complained about the battery charger not working. Last winter, 3 of mine stopped working. They were in a room at freezing temperatures. I moved them to a place at room temperature and then they starting to work again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hoyle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little vac
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love!!!!! This is a great little vac to clean up pet hair, cat litter, kitchen crumbs, etc. It's super lightweight, I can pick it up to vac blinds or other things up high. the battery lasts longer on hardwood than on carpet mode, but doesn't take too long to charge back up before I'm off again. I have 3 long haired cats, and 2 dogs, one of which is a Corgi who sheds constantly. I am continually tending to my floors. This great cordless vac makes it a whole lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wittenberg

customer_reviews.title: a Great Dane, my husband is a sawdust covered cabinet ...
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this product since 2013. I bought an extra battery for it so I could do my whole house without having to recharge. Just to give you an idea of what this thing will do. . .I have 2 cats, a Great Dane, my husband is a sawdust covered cabinet maker, and I bake with lots of flinging😁. EVERY DAY I run the Linx to keep the pet hair, sawdust, outside debris, and flour 😏 under control. Every. Day. It does a great job. Mind you, it isn’t meant to do what a big vac does, but what a lifesaver not to have to haul out the big guy every day! Thanks Hoover!
customer_reviews.author: Lee H

customer_reviews.title: Very good vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: This is really a good vacuum for being battery powered. Used for the in-between main house weekly (ish) vacuuming and for spills and dog hair that accumulate. Picks up well. Runs about 20 minutes on a charge with no brush running. Cut that time if you use the brush constantly (13-15 minutes) Mainly used on tile floors in my home. But it does do well on carpet too. Bought a spare second battery/filter and can do a 2200 sq. ft home easily with the spare.
customer_reviews.author: The Big Cat

customer_reviews.title: Only vacuum you should ever own
customer_reviews.text: Since buying this vacuum for our own...and falling in love with its light-weight but strong cleaning power, we have purchased three more to give as gifts for Christmas for family members. They are just as pleased as we are. BE SURE TO PURCHASE a second battery...makes cleaning the entire house so much easier without inconvenience of running out of battery power before task is complete.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Paper Weight.
customer_reviews.text: Well after using this for 6 months, the battery/charger quit working. We always kept a good charge on the battery and only used the vacuum on occasion to do spot cleaning. I would have hoped that the product would have better life. It makes the "Hoover" name look like an inferior product. Now we can buy a new charger for the price of the entire unit. Is that fair? I think not. No more Hoover for us.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy S.

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum for quick pickups.
customer_reviews.text: I really do like this vacuum. This is my second one (keep one at each end of the house) although that is not really needed. This model is light weight and battery powered thus you can grab it and vacuum spills or just use it for the whole house, very quickly. Easy to clean. Only recommendation is that if buyer wants it as a whole house cleaner, I suggest investing in a backup battery.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: It's great...if there's no dirt or hair on the floor
customer_reviews.text: We have one of these in our office, and I was impressed by how well it worked and how light it was. I purchased for quick cleans in between regular vacuuming. Then I used it at home. With real carpets. And a dog. It was never up to dog hair, barely picked any up. I've had it now for several months. It still works ok on bare floors, but it has a clog somewhere that I can't get to. It continues to underwhelm me.
customer_reviews.author: whozeshoes

customer_reviews.title: ... vacuum just for a few days but I absolutely love it. I had a different brand before but ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this vacuum just for a few days but I absolutely love it. I had a different brand before but this one has a much longer battery life. I have no carpet in my house so I just use the hard floor option and it works way better than my other. I also purchased the extra battery but I can do the whole house on 1 battery and have life still in the first battery. My home is just under 1700 sq ft so not very big - but the other vacuum couldn't make the entire house. I highly recommend this cordless vac to anyone looking for one!
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: A great little vaccum
customer_reviews.text: I had a Red Devil that I just loved but hair and particles could clog it. But the roller broke and there was no way to fix it. Looking around for a while, I had had Hoover vacuums before so it was a toss up and I selected this Linx cordless. It was a good choice. I picks up like crazy, fills and empties easily. Charging doesn't take anytime and ready to go. I have 2 large hairy dogs and 2 long haired cats which I love dearly and which this vacuum loves also by the hair it picks up. It is not my main house vacuum but it works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Quisenberry

customer_reviews.title: I LIKE THAT IT IS CORDLESS & BAGLESS
customer_reviews.text: YESTERDAY I RECEIVED MY NEW HOOVER CORDLESS VACUUM CLEANER. I FULLY CHARGED THE BATTERY, & GAVE IT A TRY. I VACUUMED MY ENTIRE 14' X 70' MOBILE HOME, & ONLY LOST 1 BAR ON THE BATTERY FUEL GAUGE. MY ENTIRE HOME HAS CARPETING, SO I USED THE BRUSH THE WHOLE TIME. I LIKE THAT IT IS BAGLESS. I ALSO ORDERED A SPARE BATTERY, & 3 EXTRA FOAM FILTERS. IT IS ALOT EASIER ON MY BAD BACK, THAN THE CORDED FULL SIZED HOOVER I STILL HAVE. I HOPE THIS CORDLESS HOOVER LASTS AS LONG AS THE CORDED BAGGED HOOVERS I HAVE HAD IN THE PAST. SO FAR, SO GOOD.
customer_reviews.author: GOLDENROD

customer_reviews.title: Push dirt from one side of the room to another.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this vacuum as a lower end vacum so, I didn't have to buy a Dyson what a disappointment. The noise level is not bad but the cleaning potiental is non existent this vacum pushes dirt from one place to another and is not a sealed/closed bagless system so if you allergens expect it to get worst. Now, I am buying a Dyson so I have spent the cost of this plus the cost of a Dyson for 1 actual working vacum. Save a little more and get a better Vacum.
customer_reviews.author: Susan U Erondu

customer_reviews.title: Won't replace a full vacuum cleaner
customer_reviews.text: We always use the brushes. Without them the suction won't get much for you. We love it for quick pickups of dog hair. Works great on the entry carpets. The only reason to leave off the fifth star is you need to know that it doesn't have the suction of a regular good vacuum. It picks up better moving forward than in reverse because that allows the brushes to help get the dirt up to where the suction can take it in. We have had it for a while and the battery is holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: 60Something

customer_reviews.title: SMALL, EASY, SIMPLE,  POWERFUL!
customer_reviews.text: GET IT!! Don't wait like I did - I wish I'd have gotten it sooner. I compared and thoroughly read about every vacuum in this category. This vacuum is the best if you're looking for simple, lightweight, easy to grab, every day use. The point of a little vacuum was to be simple and quick so I was glad I didn't go with extra attachments, wall mounts, or large-based models. You can charge this little battery anywhere and the vacuum blends into any room with no loud colors. For the (fairly) low price I don't expect it to last forever but will be happy to get a few years out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Carpet and Tile cleaning
customer_reviews.text: Good for hard wood floors and picking up pet hair. Not good for cleaning carpet. Leaves more dirt on the carpet than it picks up. Does not have enough suction to pickup dirt in the grout lines of a tile floor especially if they are a little deep. Would only recommend for hard wood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Holly P.

customer_reviews.title: Great for daily cleanup in the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This little sweeper is great for daily cleanup. This is the second one that I have ordered. I had the first one for about five years. It stopped working after I dropped it. After reading reviews of other vacuums, I decided that this one was best for me. I still use my regular vacuum for weekly cleaning and for rugs and carpets, but this is great for daily cleanup work. It works very well on hardwood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Bargersville shopper

customer_reviews.title: The BEST
customer_reviews.text: I have personally had a Hoover Linx Cordless Stick Vacuum for a few years. I recently purchased one for my daughter and she is thrilled with it. It does a great job PLUS you are not fighting with a cord all the time. The power lasts a long time before it needs recharging. It is easy to clean the dirt tank and does an amazing job on both bare floors and carpeting.
customer_reviews.author: MHK

customer_reviews.title: Did not last too long
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for about a year. Then the roller brush stopped working. I used it only on a hardwood floor to pick up dog hair. I need to bring it to a service center located almost thirty miles away to have it "repaired". A quality company who truly cares about long term return customers (which I am) would've sent out a replacement lower portion or whatever. But making me travel sixty miles seems somewhat not customer friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Jakebullett

customer_reviews.title: If you have hard floors- get the Linx!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Hoover Link- the first one is almost two years old and still works like the day I bought it. I got a second for upstairs. Very maneuverable around corners and edges, excellent suction, great battery life and quick charging. No complaints whatsoever - and i live in the desert, in a dust bowl, so these little guys get lots of action! I use them every single day. I had the Dyson cordless but didn’t feel it was any better and i disliked having to constantly hold the button, and the price, so it went back and the Hoover stayed! I do have two big Dyson’s for carpet and deeper cleanings though.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hrubiak

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: When my trusty Hoover finally died I decided to try some different brands and styles. I have 5 dogs,2 cats and a husband who cannot be trained to wipe his feet. My vacuum has to be good! After returning 3 different cordless vacuum cleaners I bought another Hoover, just like my old one that had finally worn out. What a relief! I can walk barefoot on my floors again without having to wash my feet! This Hoover really sucks! Would give it moor stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Suz

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and time, skip this one, borrow a dog.
customer_reviews.text: Awful. Simply awful. Suction is poor. Battery life is poor. Running the roller makes it worse. Rollers will throw things underneath at your feet, not into the vacuum, because it lacks the suction strength. Cheerios are too large to go underneath, but raisins are too heavy together sucked up. Dont bother with carpet. Skip this, and have the neighbors and his/her dog over for an hour while the dog does what this cant.
customer_reviews.author: FFFF00laz3rb33m

customer_reviews.title: but otherwise it is great to walk across the floor with no sand ot ...
customer_reviews.text: Need to pick up dog hair and oak tree shedding ahead of time because it clogs the filter, but otherwise it is great to walk across the floor with no sand ot grit underfoot. Filter is relatively easy to clean. Battery lasts long enough to clean several rooms and the lights warn me when it is getting low. I really do like it - more than a broom, more than the corded one for heavier cleaning projects.
customer_reviews.author: Piano doglady

customer_reviews.title: Like so Much I bought 4
customer_reviews.text: After buying one of these, my wife and I liked it so much, we bought three more -- an extra one for the upstairs and two for gifts. It make vacuuming so easy. I would suggest buying a second battery so that you have one on full charge at all times. The only problem is that it will become "stopped up" if it is not emptied regularly. I don't endorse many products, but I give this one an A+.
customer_reviews.author: Larry M. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Battery life has been good and I bought a spare battery for it so ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my roomba backup. It's light, and has lots of suction to clean places that the roomba wont fit. Battery life has been good and I bought a spare battery for it so I never run out of juice. Only con is the dust container will drop out while vacuuming sometimes. It happened to me a couple of times and I solved that with a strip of 100 mile an hour tape around that dust container. A more positive latch at the top would cure this problem but duct tape is a cheap solution.
customer_reviews.author: Shifty

customer_reviews.title: Worth less than zero
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this during an AmazonPrime sale. Big mistake. There is no surface on which this vacuum has enough suction power to make it worth using. I literally gave it away to Salvation Army, but now I feel bad about that because I should have just put it in the trash. I am not being overly critical....this product was worth less than zero to me and I am having trouble processing how anyone could give it positive reviews. Maybe I had a dud. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: NoMyth

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Decent enough for the price. Doesn't do very well when it comes to pet hair on furniture. Not because of the brush or the suction power but because of the mobility on the head itself is stationary. Unlike a Dyson which I'm used to. But you can definitely make it work. Great for a small place with just a couple small animals.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Buy something different
customer_reviews.text: After a year of ownership/use, here's our experience: Pros: Looks nice, light, good design for emptying dirt cup, haven't had to change or clean filter, handles nicely, battery has lasted well Cons: Doesn't lock into upright position as reliably anymore (will easily fall & eject the dirt cup), dirt pathway clogs too easily, suction is really mediocre (at best), has required several disassemblies to remove hair from roll/parts/airway The convenience of cordless is clearly the future. Battery power is available for much greater suction (see Ego outdoor products, for example). Something excellent will be on its way (if not available now), and from our experience this is a product to be avoided.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Winterbourne

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vacuum largely because of the rug I have under the kitchen table. No matter how often I swept it never seemed to get up all the crumbs, and lugging out the larger vacuum was such a pain. This one is perfect! It's lightweight, small (doesn't take up much room in the closet). and has good suction on the carpet as well as the surrounding hardwood floor. It's easy to switch mid-cleaning from rug to hardwood and then back again as needed. Also simple to empty the canister when done. One of most useful purchases I've made recently!
customer_reviews.author: Paula Smith

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk. It falls apart constantly. Whenever I lift it up by the handle, the handle pulls out and the rest of the vacuum falls to the floor - knocking out the canister and filter. A cordless vacuum that comes a apart overtime you lift it up is frustrating. There doesn't seem to be anything to hook the handle to the rest of the vacuum, it just slides in a hole and can slide right out. I am going to buy a different brand to replace this vacuum,.
customer_reviews.author: 47RTS

customer_reviews.title: get what  you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I decided on this vac after doing a ton of research on cordless ones. While the battery will not last long enough to clean your entire home, it is more than enough time to clean your living room and kitchen etc after a long day w the kids. Suction is solid. easy to maneuver. i like the removable battery for charging. lightweight good quality vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Alonge

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm... until it dies
customer_reviews.text: My mom loves the convenience and light weight of this vacuum. Unfortunately it only lasts about a year with daily light-cleaning use... I know because we're on the 3rd one. Looks like I'm doomed to keep buying new ones as long as mom loves uses them. :0/
customer_reviews.author: Linda Haskell

customer_reviews.title: Great for Daily Clean-up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vacuum in 2016 for my kids to start learning how to vacuum. It's been used pretty much daily for our hard floors for the past 4 years. We use it occasionally on carpets for quick clean up but it doesn't have the power for truly cleaning carpets. For quick, daily cleaning this is totally worth the price. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: NMCK

customer_reviews.title: Hoover vac recommended by Heloise
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is lightweight and cordless. It does a good job on hardwood floors... but 1) there are no attachments, making it difficult to get under and behind furniture, 2) the battery lasts 15 - 30 minutes -- not enough to clean even 1 floor in our house. The setting for rugs does not seem to clean my deep pile carpets very well. You need a second battery to finish most vacuuming jobs. This vacuum is fine for quick, main floor area cleanup, but definitely not a replacement for a good vac, like Kirby or Rainbow.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Podominick

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I have. One is upstairs and one is downstairs. This little light-weight cleaner is a work horse. It does an excellent job on either carpets or wood. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Great suction, light, easy to empty.
customer_reviews.text: I love my Vaccum. This is the second one I buoying. I bought one three years ago and I gave that one to my son just recently. Great suction and works great on carpet and hardwood. The battery last easily for 30 minutes. Great product and good value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with This Vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to do quick clean-ups in my bedroom, and now use it for most of my vacuuming jobs. It picks up cat hair on the carpet as well as my expensive canister vacuum, does an excellent job on hard floors, is easy to use, maneuverable, not too heavy, and the charge lasts quite a while. My only complaint is that I do have to empty out the receptacle regularly, but I think that is due mainly to the cat hair, AND it is much preferable, and involves much less waste, than using (expensive) vacuum bags.
customer_reviews.author: mollipop

customer_reviews.title: Good Vacuum when it works but many issues
customer_reviews.text: I haven't even had this vacuum for a year. I've had the battery replaced and the charger and battery is not working again. When you need something replaced you are responsible for shipping it out to Hoover and then they will send the replacement part. This means you pay for the shipping and you have to wait weeks for a replacement. The vacuum works well when it is working but battery doesn't last very long. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is truly a great little vacuum cleaner
customer_reviews.text: This is truly a great little vacuum cleaner. I looked at some of the other "big name" brands, but this one has them all beat. Larger capacity dust bin, light weight, great battery life, easy to use, and easy to pull the battery and empty the dust bin. And much less expensive that many of the others. We have three large shedding dogs and dark brown tile floors, so we use this little vac at least once a day - sometimes more. We've had it for a year now, and it's still running strong / working great. I just can't say enough good things about it. Very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ManBehindTheCurtain

customer_reviews.title: I also like the feature where you just need to charge a ...
customer_reviews.text: We had an Electrolux for a long time. We purchased the Hoover Linx for my mother as a gift and once we tried hers we couldn't believe how well it work. So we bought one for ourselves. Surprising the battery lasts longer in the Hoover than the old one we had (we have all tile/hardwood floors). I also like the feature where you just need to charge a battery in a small stand and then you can put the vacuum away in the closet.
customer_reviews.author: BARBARA SANDERS

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, lightweight! Good for small people and their cats!
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second Hoover Linx. The first one lasted two years and was no longer efficient. I gave it to a friend who found a lot of dirt stuck between the large handle and the bottom part. I hadn't known you could separate the two and a lot of hair was stuck there. Now my friend is using the old vacuum. It isn't extremely powerful but works for daily cleaning and picking up cat hair. I like to use it because there's no cord, and it's lightweight which makes it easier for me to zip around the house daily.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, good suction, easy cleanout.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to maneuver and lift or move around for cleaning areas. Lightweight, good suction, good battery life. Easy to dump debris and clean inside when needed. I like that it has 2 options for vacuuming, one with the roller moving for perhaps carpet, and second option is suction without roller for hard surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Convenience is Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is really handy. We keep it conveniently in a closet & use it for all small jobs. This is our second one purchased. Our first died from over use as we swept Christmas needles, which I would not recommend. We purchased a second one because we had come to rely on this little Stick & our first had lasted a fairly long time, considering our use. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is that I think its durability could be improved.
customer_reviews.author: Susan S.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, quiet, picks up well and best of all the battery is separate from the vacuum so you do not have to have the sweeper plugged into an outlet, just the small battery. Easy to sweep up my hardwoods after a meal. Also picks up my dog and cat hair.
customer_reviews.author: Murphy

customer_reviews.title: good suction
customer_reviews.text: Best vac/sweeper I've ever owned. Just purchased a second one to keep upstairs as I have a bad back and find it difficult to carry upstair. My first one (purchased 4 years ago) is still going strong. Battery doesn't last quite as long as when it was new, however, I can still do livingroom and office carpet and 2 rooms w/hardwood floors before recharging. Suction is very good and even gets the light dust up from hardwood floors. Will keep buying.
customer_reviews.author: larmar71

customer_reviews.title: Defective product from unreliable seller
customer_reviews.text: I used the vacuum four times over three months and then the battery died and wouldn't charge again. Amazon referred me to the seller as it was outside Amazon's return window, so I requested a replacement battery. I received a response riddled with typos and formatting issues indicative of a nonprofessional group saying they didn't have that battery in stock. They said I needed to contact their American office as they only deal with UK and European models, and provided no contact information for that supposed office. Even without the administrative issues, the vacuum is poorly made and I had to go over sections of rug three or four times to clean them.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan H

customer_reviews.title: Owned since 2014
customer_reviews.text: I am just now seeing the life of my battery shortening for this model so I hopped on Amazon to see my options. I was so surprised to see that I have owned this for 6 years!! I purchased in 2014. It’s been an awesome cordlesss vac. Would buy again, no question. If batteries aren’t available, I probably will.
customer_reviews.author: Dorrie A

customer_reviews.title: Great for a quick Clean-Up
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Hoover Linx BH50010. I had my first one for about 5 years of multiple daily uses. I live in an older house on the outside of a curve on a very busy street. I find it useful for tidying up the dust that filters in. I use a Rainbow Vacuum for deep cleaning .. Places where one would need a vacuum with a wand like under tight spaces, ceilings and above doors and window sills But I just love the Hoover Linx, it is so much fun to run it around for a quick touch up.
customer_reviews.author: S.Change

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great for use on wood floors when you don't want to pull out the big old vacuum. A godsend if you are too feeble to use a standard vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Larry B

customer_reviews.title: battery died in 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product new and the battery died in 4 months. Although it has a 2 year warranty, Hoover told me that you have to send the defective unit and pay the shipping costs of that to get a new one. This would be more or less the same cost than purchasing a new one in amazon, so they didn't solve the problem. This is the last time I buy a Hoover product. I don't think that the $120 that I paid to Hoover has dissolved in 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Javier L.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS VACUUM!
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the other reviews about the bad battery life. After 4 months of light usage the battery no longer charges. It lasted just long enough to put it beyond the 3 month limited warranty period which is probably next to useless anyway. Even if there were no battery issues I still wouldn't buy this vacuum again. It was constantly getting plugged up and had to be taken apart to clean it out. This vacuum is now outside in my garbage can and I'm going to buy a more powerful vacuum with a cord.
customer_reviews.author: Not of the world

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum
customer_reviews.text: My elderly mother wanted this to use on her hardwood floors and carpet for touch up sweeping. This way she didn’t have to lug out her much larger heavier vacuum all the time. She loves it and says it works great. She is thrilled with it. She was surprised at the power of it.
customer_reviews.author: HappyHouseWife

customer_reviews.title: Light and functional
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase in less than a year. The first was for a business setting. Plus points - Detachable battery and indicator that extends the range. Easy enough to get a second battery. Good suction for light jobs on low pile carpets or hard surfaces. Easy to switch settings and dismantle for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Kayvee

customer_reviews.title: Charge lasts longer than any others.
customer_reviews.text: Love this simple cordless vacuum! We use it on carpeted stairs, area rugs, floors. Great suction for such a small machine. Easy to empty! We have a dog who sheds year round and I have long hair that falls out all year as well. This vacuum tackles hair easily!
customer_reviews.author: nancy woodford

product_meta.title: Hoover BH50010 Linx Cordless Stick Vacuum Cleaner, Lightweight, Grey
product_meta.description: The LiNX Cordless Stick Vacuum delivers upright performance, with a compact, low-profile design. Long-lasting battery power and WindTunnel Technology make this stick vacuum a standout.
feature_bullets: fade free lithium ion battery: Interchangeable batteries provide cordless Freedom to clean Anywhere
Extreme recline handle: Reach further without having to move any furniture around
Edge cleaning bristles: Removes dirt, dust, and pet hair against those hard to reach edges
WindTunnel technology: Creates channels of suction to life and remove surface debris and deep embedded dirt
Lightweight: At under 10 pounds this vacuum is portable enough to carry room to room for quick cleaning
Multi floor cleaning: Transitions from carpet to hard floors with ease

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars11,384 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
